title: Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
subhed: After initially denouncing what it described as 'fake outrage' from the media, the presidential administration eventually blamed the post on President Donald Trump's Truth Social account on an unidentified staffer's mistake and deleted it.

title: Epstein case put former minister Jack Lang under investigation and his Arab World Institute presidency at risk
byline: By Alexandre Aublanc, Philippe Ricard and Nathalie Segaunes

title: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
subhed: Seven out of the 26 members of the parliamentary group of the Party for Freedom (PVV) defected on January 20, criticizing their leader for a lack of internal democracy. The far-right party, which was part of the governing coalition in 2024 and 2025, is now only the fourth-largest group in the Dutch House of Representatives.

title: In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
subhed: The female prisoners, mostly foreign nationals who joined the Islamic State group in the 2010s, celebrate the advance of Syrian government forces, who are set to retake control of the camps and prisons in the Kurdish autonomous region under the January 30 agreement.

title: Glitz, opera and alpine spectacle mark opening of Milan-Cortina Olympics
subhed: Athletes paraded across multiple Alpine venues as organizers launched the most geographically dispersed Games in Olympic history, while Lindsey Vonn's injury-defying comeback drew early attention. Celebrations in Milan unfolded alongside protests over the presence of US immigration agents supporting the American delegation.

title: Julian Barnes bids farewell: 'There's no such thing as a perfect novel'
subhed: The British writer has published what he says will be his final book, 'Departure(s)', as he celebrates his 80th birthday. He welcomed Le Monde into his home in London for a wide-ranging conversation on his career as a writer and his body of work.

title: Danone recalls batches of infant formula in Britain, Spain, Croatia and Slovenia over potential toxin
Islamic State claims responsibility for attack on Shiite mosque that killed at least 31 in Pakistan
Iran anticipates more negotiations with the US, citing a 'positive atmosphere' during talks in Oman
Director of France's Museum of Immigration History: 'Fraternity has played a much greater role in our history than surges of xenophobia'
2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
Norway crown princess 'deeply regrets' Epstein friendship
French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
France detects Russia-linked Epstein smear attempt against Macron, says government source
EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
byline: By Stéphanie Le Bars (Damascus, Baghdad, Erbil, special correspondent)

title: Three years after an earthquake killed 54,000 people in Turkey, legal proceedings stall
This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
subhed: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

title: Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
subhed: Keen to combat the exploitation of male discontent by the far right, Reeves, who founded the American Institute for Boys and Men think tank, wrote a book that explains the appeal of this political current to men.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhed: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: The US versus human rights
'We, journalists of Agence France-Presse, believe management's plan would lead to our complete demise'
'To revive a strong integration policy, it must become a government priority, separate from the issue of immigration'
